title: Verify Given Select access for more than one hold code for the constituent event doesnot trigger error

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. User logged in successfully.
2. User should be able to Create a Master Event 
Package
3. User should be able to Perform Sale Transaction 
for the pacakge such that Attending patron is 
same as financial patron P1
4. User should be able to Add Constituent Events to 
the Package
5. User should be able to Select Utilities from Utilities 
tab.
6. User should be able to Select the Utility as Master 
Event Expansion utility from the "Set Utility For" 
drop down.
7. User should be able to Enter the parameters and 
Run the utility
8. The lock seats of constituent event should be 
successful even if the user executing the utility 
has "SELECT" access on more than one hold 
code
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. Login to the application using valid credentials.
Expected Result:
User logged in successfully.
2. Create a Master Event Package
Expected Result:
User should be able to Create a Master Event 
Package
3. Perform Sale Transaction for the pacakge such 
that Attending patron is same as financial patron 
P1
Expected Result:
User should be able to Perform Sale Transaction 
for the pacakge such that Attending patron is 
same as financial patron P1
4. Add Constituent Events to the Package
Expected Result:
User should be able to Add Constituent Events to 
the Package
5. Select Utilities from Utilities tab
Expected Result:
User should be able to Select Utilities from Utilities 
tab.
6. Select the Utility as Master Event Expansion utility 
from the "Set Utility For" drop down.
Expected Result:
User should be able to Select the Utility as Master 
Event Expansion utility from the "Set Utility For" 
drop down.
7. Enter the parameters and Run the utility
Expected Result:
User should be able to Enter the parameters and 
Run the utility
8. Navigate to Ticket Services.
Expected Result:
The lock seats of constituent event should be 
successful even if the user executing the utility 
has "SELECT" access on more than one hold 
code

title: Advanced Search-Verify the funtionality of Package Events parameter in Event Partial Package Search screen

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. User logged in successfully.
2. Ticket sales portal is dispalyed.
3. User will be taken to cart.
4. Transaction # is generated.
5. Ticket Services portal is displayed.
6. User will be taken to order details screen.
7. User will be taken to Exchange  Sales screen.
8. 1. Search results should not include single event for sale

2. Only events in searched  package should list in search results
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. Login to the application using valid credentials.
Expected Result:
User logged in successfully.
2. Navigate to Ticket sales.
Expected Result:
Ticket sales portal is dispalyed.
3. Select an package and a Patron.
Input the number of seats required and click on 'Best Available' button.
Expected Result:
User will be taken to cart.
4. Input the delivery method and payment method and complete the sales transaction.
Expected Result:
Transaction # is generated.
5. Navigate to Ticket Services portal.
Expected Result:
Ticket Services portal is displayed.
6. Input Transaction ID and click on order number dispalyed.
Expected Result:
User will be taken to order details screen.
7. Select Exchange option from 'Select Action' drop down. 
Select the seats to be Exchanged and click on 'Apply Action' button.
Expected Result:
User will be taken to Exchange  Sales screen.
8. Verify the funtionality of Package Events parameter in Event Partial Package Search screen

-Invoke Advanced search
-Input a package name in Package parameter
-Find
Expected Result:
1. Search results should not include single event for sale

2. Only events in searched  package should list in search results

title: Verify the grids are larger and still fully functional.

2. User should logged into the application successfully
3. user navigated to Event Access page
4. The grid size should be increased and user should able to add lots of data in the fields.
The scroll bar should be displayed when lots of data is added.

The scroll bar should be displayed when lots of data is added.

2.Click on "Event Access" tab

user navigated to Event Access page

The scroll bar should be displayed when lots of data is added.

6. 1)By giving lots of data in the grid so that the scroll bar will appear
2)The grids are larger and still fully functional in the Event Access:-Hold Codes, Reservation Codes, Delivery Card Types, and Payment Plans grids

The scroll bar should be displayed when lots of data is added.
7. Click on "Log Out" button
Expected Result:
User should be logged out from the application successfully

title: Verify whether any Validation Message is displayed when buyer type is mapped to itself for Arts supplier

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. The PV Application should be launched without any issues.
2. The user should be able to login into PV application.
3. The transaction should be completed successfully.
4. Transaction details should be displayed.
5. User should be able to create new run.
6. User should able to map the buyer type to itself.
7. Validation Message should not be displayed when buyer type is mapped to itself for Arts supplier.
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. Launch PV application.
Expected Result:
The PV Application should be launched without any issues.
2. Login using valid credentials
Expected Result:
The user should be able to login into PV application.
3. Navigate to Ticket Sales and perform transaction for Arts event.
Expected Result:
The transaction should be completed successfully.
4. Navigate to Transaction details page and click on Order id.
Expected Result:
Transaction details should be displayed.
5. Navigates to Utilities and Select Re offer / Re price utility and create new run.
Expected Result:
User should be able to create new run.
6. Map the Buyer type to itself. Eg:  ADULT buyer should be re priced to ADULT itself, that is, Adult(source) -> Adult (target) and No ADULT should be found as source or target in mapping panel
Expected Result:
User should able to map the buyer type to itself.
7. Verify whether any Validation Message is displayed when buyer type is mapped to itself for Arts supplier.
Expected Result:
Validation Message should not be displayed when buyer type is mapped to itself for Arts supplier.

title: Event-Verify the functionality of the operators available in BUYER TYPE attribute

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Login to the application using valid credentials.
2. Create a new Event EVT1, EVT2 with BUYER TYPE1.

System should have TWO Patrons P1,P2 who have done  transactions  with BUYER TYPE1.

System should have Patron P3 who have done transactions with  BUYER TYPE2.
3. Navigate to Utilities portal and select BULK TRAIT utility from 'Set Utility For' drop down.
4. Search for a Supplier
5. Provide a Search criteria for selecting a set of Patrons using EVENT attributes.

1.In SEARCH CRITERIA section select ALL from the drop down.
2.Select EVENT  Category.
3.Select an attribute, say BUYER TYPE and Value BUYER TYPE1
4.Select the operator as DOES NOT EQUAL(Exclude it in search option)
5.Click on Validate button.
6. Provide a Search criteria for selecting a set of Patrons using EVENT attributes.

1.In SEARCH CRITERIA section select ALL from the drop down.
2.Select EVENT  Category.
3.Select an attribute, say BUYER TYPE and Value BUYER TYPE1,BUYER TYPE2.
4.Select the operator as IS IN LIST(Include it in search option)
5.Click on Validate button.
7. Provide a Search criteria for selecting a set of Patrons using EVENT attributes.

1.In SEARCH CRITERIA section select ALL from the drop down.
2.Select EVENT  Category.
3.Select an attribute, say BUYER TYPE and Value BUYER TYPE1,BUYER TYPE2.
4.Select the operator as IS NOT IN LIST(Exclude it in search option)
5.Click on Validate button.
8. Repeat the validation process for different combination of search Criteria
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. User logged in successfully.
2. 
3. Bulk Trait Utility portal is loaded.
4. A particular Supplier can be found.
5. The patrons P3 will be  selected and the Patron counts will be displayed below the section.
6. The patrons P1,P2,P3 will be selected and the Patron counts will be displayed below the section.
7. The patrons P1,P2,P3 will NOT be selected and the Patron counts will be displayed below the section.
8. Patron counts will be displayed below the section as per the search criteria.

title: Event-Verify whether Trait can be REMOVED via Bulk Trait Utility using search criteria - MARKET OFFER STATUS

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Create a new Event EVT1 & EVT2 with EVENT  DATE1.

Do some transactions with these Events for Patrons P1,P2,P3.

P2 and P3 has got some trait applied to it.

User has DELETE permission in Org Admin
2. Login to PV with valid credentials
3. Select utilities portal
4. Select 'Bulk trait' from 'Set Utility For' Dropdown
5. In Serach criteria- Select Category as ' EVENT' in the dropdown
6. Select the Attribute as MARKET OFFER STATUS
7. 1.Click on MARKET OFFER STATUS
2.Select radio button Include
3.Click on Add new
8. Search MARKET OFFER STATUS by Find button
9. Select the MARKET OFFER STATUS by selecting the checkboxes
10. Click on OK
11. Click on Validate
12. Enter Trait:
Select the Account radio button from "Account or Contact"
13. Select the radio button- "REMOVE trait" from "Update Behavior"
14. Select the "Trait" from the Trait dropdown and enter the trait
15. Click on Preview
16. Click on "Set Traits"
17. Verify the traits for each patron in pre-requisite in patron management portal
18. Repeat above steps with :
1. Exclude option ,
2. Include option with multiple selection,
3. Exclude oiption with multiple selection in Step 6
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. 
2. Login should be successful and the home page of the applcation should be launched
3. Utilities portal should be selected successfully

9. The MARKET OFFER STATUS should be successfully selected
10. The MARKET OFFER STATUS should be successfully selected & displayed in the list.
11. Valdiation should be successful.Patron count should be displayed.
12. Account radio button should be successfully selected
13. The Remove trait radio button should be successfully selected
14. System should accept the user selected Trait
15. The criteria validation and total patron count should be successfully previewed
16. Utility run should start and should  successfully be completed
17. The traits must be Removed for P2 and P3 and to all Patrons who has trait assigned already.
18. 1. The patrons with account type excluded should not be added with trait
2. The patrons with account types included should be added with trait
3. The patrons with account types excluded should not be addedwith trait
